sen.j: 芝 祐泰（しば すけひろ、1898年3月19日 - 1982年10月10日）は、雅楽家、東京生まれの日本芸術院会員である。
sen.e: Sukehiro SHIBA (March 19, 1898 to October 10, 1982) was a gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music) born in Tokyo and was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
Sukehiro SHIBA (March 19, 1898 to October 10, 1982) was a gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music) born in Tokyo and was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
Sukehiro SHIBA (March 19, 1898 to October 10, 1982) was a gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music) born in Tokyo and was a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 古代以来の宮廷雅楽師狛氏の一族で、鎌倉時代の芝真葛より分かれた。
sen.e: He belonged to Koma clana, a family of Kyutei gagaku (old Japanese court music) since ancient times, which was separated from Mazuku SHIBA of the Kamakura period.
He belonged to the Koma clan, a family of Kyutei gagaku (old Japanese court music) since ancient times, which was separated from Mazuku SHIBA of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: He belonged to the Koma clan, a family of Kyutei gagaku (old Japanese court music) since ancient times, which was separated from Mazuku SHIBA of the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 父は芝祐夏（1859－1928）、長男は芝祐久、次男が東京芸術大学教授の芝祐靖。
sen.e: His father is Sukenatsu SHIBA and his eldest son is Sukehisa SHIBA, and his second son Sukeyasu SHIBA, a professor ofTokyo University of the Arts.
His father is Sukenatsu SHIBA and his eldest son is Sukehisa SHIBA, and his second son Sukeyasu SHIBA, a professor of Tokyo University of the Arts.
sen.cmt: スペースが抜けていました。
sen.e: His father is Sukenatsu SHIBA and his eldest son is Sukehisa SHIBA, and his second son Sukeyasu SHIBA, a professor of Tokyo University of the Arts.

tit.cmt: 訳抜けに対応しました。

sen.j: 1921年：宮内省雅楽練習所を卒業。
sen.e: 1921: graduated from Gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) Training Institute of the Imperial Household Ministry.
1921: graduated from Gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) Training Institute of the Imperial Household Ministry.
1921: graduated from Gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) Training Institute of the Imperial Household Ministry.

sen.j: 1923年：東洋音楽学校講師に就任。
sen.e: 1923: Assumed a lecturer at Toyo Musical School
1923: Assumed a lecturer at Toyo Musical School.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを入れました。
sen.e: 1923: Assumed a lecturer at Toyo Musical School.
1925: Assumed a professor of Music Department of the Imperial Household Ministry.
1925: Assumed a professor of Music Department of the Imperial Household.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを入れました。
sen.e: 1925: Assumed a professor of Music Department of the Imperial Household.

sen.j: 1928年：昭和天皇即位の礼で神楽歌を奏する。
sen.e: 1928: played kagurauta (a kagura chant performed during sacred Shinto music and dancing) on the occasion of the enthronement of the Emperor Showa
1928: played kagurauta (a kagura chant performed during sacred Shinto music and dancing) on the occasion of the enthronement of Emperor Showa.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを入れました。不要なスペースをとりました。Grammar
sen.e: 1928: played kagurauta (a kagura chant performed during sacred Shinto music and dancing) on the occasion of the enthronement of Emperor Showa.

sen.j: 1932年：伊勢神宮神部署雅楽教授。
sen.e: 1932: Assumed a professor of gagaku, Kanbe Department, Ise Jingu Shrine.
1932: Assumed a professor of gagaku, Kanbe Department, Ise Jingu Shrine.
1932: Assumed a professor of gagaku, Kanbe Department, Ise Jingu Shrine.
1946: Appointed to a gikan (bureaucrat with specialized skills) of Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency)
1946: Appointed to a gikan (bureaucrat with specialized skills) of Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを入れました。
sen.e: 1946: Appointed to a gikan (bureaucrat with specialized skills) of Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency).
1948: Received an Award of the Japan Art Academy
1948: Received an Award of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを入れました。
sen.e: 1948: Received an Award of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 1950年：宮内庁楽長、日本芸術院会員となる。
sen.e: 1950: Appointed Music Master of the Imperial Household Ministry, became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
1950: Appointed Music Master of the Imperial Household Ministry, became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
1950: Appointed Music Master of the Imperial Household Ministry, became a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 1955年：国立音楽大学教授に就任。
sen.e: 1955: Assumed a professor at Kunitachi College of Music.
1955: Assumed a professor at Kunitachi College of Music.
1955: Assumed a professor at Kunitachi College of Music.
1965: Assumed Director of the Third Department of The Japan Art Academy
1965: Assumed Director of the Third Department of The Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを入れました。
sen.e: 1965: Assumed Director of the Third Department of The Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 1968年：勲三等旭日中綬章を授かる。
sen.e: 1968: Awarded The Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon
1968: Awarded The Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを入れました。
sen.e: 1968: Awarded The Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.

sen.j: 雅楽 第1-2集 竜吟社 1955-56
sen.e: Gagaku Volume 1, 2 Ryukin-sha 1955-56
